wikipedia_page.main: George Whiteside Hillyard (6 February 1864 – 24 March 1943) was a male tennis player from the United Kingdom. Under his supervision as secretary of the All England Club from 1907 to 1925, the Wimbledon Championships moved to its current site at Church Road. Hillyard also excelled at cricket and golf.

In 1889 Pim won the men's singles competition in the Yorkshire County Championship.Ilkley Gazette, 3 August 1889, p. 5. His first significant tennis triumph came in the following year when he and fellow Lansdowne member Frank Stoker (a relation of the writer Bram Stoker) won the Irish men's doubles championship.Daily Express, Dublin, 2 June 1890, p. 2. Pim then took the men’s singles title at the prestigious English Northern ChampionshipsLiverpool Mercury, 23 June 1890, p. 7. and immediately afterwards he and Stoker added the Wimbledon doubles title to their Irish success.Sheffield Daily Telegraph, 24 July 1890, p. 8. In the Wimbledon singles he reached the semi-finals where he was defeated by Willoughby Hamilton from Kildare, who went on to win the championship.Sheffield Daily Telegraph, 11 July 1890, p. 5. At Dublin he had lost the final round of the "all-comers" singles in five sets to Ernest LewisDaily Express, Dublin, 31 May 1890, p. 4. who, partnered by George Hillyard, was defeated by Pim and Stoker in both the Irish and English doubles finals.Belfast News-Letter, 3 June 1890, p. 3; Sheffield Daily Telegraph, 24 July 1890, p. 8.

Tennis at the 1908 Summer Olympics – Men's outdoor doubles
response: The men's outdoor doubles' was one of six lawn tennis events on the Tennis at the 1908 Summer Olympics programme. Nations could enter up to 6 pairs (12 players).Official Report, p. 35. The event was plagued by withdrawals, with only 12 teams competing of the 21 that entered. There were 24 players from 8 nations. The event was won by Reginald Doherty and George Hillyard after defeating James Cecil Parke and Major Ritchie in the final. Clement Cazalet and Charles P. Dixon took the bronze medal without a bronze medal match due to the withdrawal of an entire quadrant of the bracket. All three medal pairs were British. It was the second medal sweep in the men's doubles, after the United States did it in 1904, and it was also the last time that the men's doubles gold medal match was contested by pairs representing the same nation until Tokyo 2021. Doherty became the first man to win multiple men's doubles medals and gold medals, having earned gold with his brother Laurence Doherty in 1900.

The British brothers Laurence Doherty and Reginald Doherty had been dominant for the late 1890s and early 1900s, winning the 1900 Olympic championship and eight consecutive Wimbledon titles. Laurence retired in 1906, however, leaving Reginald to search for other partners. He played with George Hillyard, an accomplished player past his prime, for the 1908 Olympic tournament. Arthur Gore and Herbert Roper Barrett, who had won the indoor doubles event, were among the most notable late scratches.Official Report, p. 216.
